title: Acute Renal Failure after Cardiac Surgery (Thakar Score)
description: Predicts risk of acute kidney injury (AKI) requiring dialysis after cardiac surgery. The score was developed and validated in over 33,000 patients at the Cleveland Clinic Foundation.

parameters.name: preoperative_iabp
parameters.description: Preoperative use of intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP)

result.name: thakar_score
result.description: Thakar score for acute renal failure risk after cardiac surgery (0-17 points)

ranges.description: Very low risk for AKI requiring dialysis
ranges.interpretation: Score 0-2 points: Very low risk (0.3-0.5% risk of AKI requiring dialysis). These patients have excellent renal prognosis after cardiac surgery.

ranges.description: Low risk for AKI requiring dialysis
ranges.interpretation: Score 3-5 points: Low risk (1.8-3.3% risk of AKI requiring dialysis). Standard perioperative renal monitoring is appropriate.

ranges.description: Moderate risk for AKI requiring dialysis
ranges.interpretation: Score 6-8 points: Moderate risk (7.8-11.4% risk of AKI requiring dialysis). Consider enhanced renal monitoring and nephrotoxin avoidance.

ranges.description: High risk for AKI requiring dialysis
ranges.interpretation: Score 9-13 points: High risk (18.6-22.1% risk of AKI requiring dialysis). Aggressive renal protection strategies warranted, nephrology consultation may be beneficial.

ranges.description: Very high risk for AKI requiring dialysis
ranges.interpretation: Score >13 points: Very high risk (>22% risk of AKI requiring dialysis). Consider postponing surgery if possible to optimize patient, nephrology consultation recommended.

references: Thakar CV, Arrigain S, Worley S, Yared JP, Paganini EP. A clinical score to predict acute renal failure after cardiac surgery. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2005 Jan;16(1):162-8. doi: 10.1681/ASN.2004040331.
Chertow GM, Levy EM, Hammermeister KE, Grover F, Daley J. Independent association between acute renal failure and mortality following cardiac surgery. Am J Med. 1998 Apr;104(4):343-8.
Bove T, Monaco F, Covello RD, Zangrillo A. Acute renal failure and cardiac surgery. HSR Proc Intensive Care Cardiovasc Anesth. 2009;1(3):13-21.
formula: Points assigned: Female gender (+1), CHF (+1), LVEF <35% (+1), Preop IABP (+2), COPD (+1), Insulin-requiring DM (+1), Previous cardiac surgery (+1), Emergency surgery (+2), Valve only surgery (+1), CABG+valve or other surgery (+2), Preop creatinine 1.2-2.0 mg/dL (+2), Preop creatinine >2.0 mg/dL (+5). Total score 0-17 points.
notes: The score was developed and validated in 33,217 patients at Cleveland Clinic (1993-2002)
Primary outcome was acute renal failure requiring dialysis
Area under ROC curve was 0.81 in development set and 0.82 in validation set
Score is most accurate for predicting need for dialysis, not mild AKI
Consider using in conjunction with clinical judgment for surgical risk assessment
